009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * This ImageJ plugin shows how to access the one-dimensional pixel array
018 * of a 8-bit (= byte) grayscale image.
019 * Each pixel value is increased by 10 without range limiting, i.e., bright values
020 * wrap back to black etc.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 *
024 */
025public class Direct_Byte_Pixel_Access implements PlugInFilter {
026
027        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus img) {
028                return DOES_8G;         // this plugin accepts 8-bit grayscale images
029        }
030
031        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
032                ByteProcessor bp = (ByteProcessor) ip;  // DOES_8G only, thus this must work
033                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) bp.getPixels();
034                int w = bp.getWidth();
035                int h = bp.getHeight();
036
037                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
038                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
039                                int p = 0xFF & pixels[v * w + u]; // bitmask 0xFF is needed for unsigned values
040                                p = p + 10;
041                                pixels[v * w + u] = (byte) (0xFF & p); 
042                        }
043                }
044        }
045
046}
